>Message submit failed!
>Parsing parameters... Please try again later.

topic.title: Change site owner
topic.body: Let's say someone wants me to be the owner of its website so I can make modifications. Is it possible to do this without changing the site adress ?

topic.title: Find site creator
topic.body: Is it possible to find which person has created which site ?

topic.title: ZeroNet = deep web ?
topic.body: Can ZeroNet be considred as a part of the deep web ?

topic.title: Fuck the terrorism
topic.body:
It happened again yesterday, in Belgium.

Fuck it.

2_15NScazvsCHNmiXi6o6nvaMiwjeJYizgZQ.body: VPN is better than a proxy

4_1MxdAjWgnqwCaunGHmhY39tVR51qV3peJL.body:
You can backup *\ZeroNet\data\users.json to backup your user
If you backup your whole ZeroNet folder it will take a lot of time as it contains the websites you visited (thousands of files)

1_1BGaNcH1UBqAdatPbT3YssmPRVdhepMNPW.body: Works well with a french OpenVPN :)
I have an OpenVPN server on my own Linux server with all ports opened, but my ZeroNet dashboard says I have my port closed. Why ?

10_1MxdAjWgnqwCaunGHmhY39tVR51qV3peJL.body:
> [ripper234](#comment_15_1MxdAjWgnqwCaunGHmhY39tVR51qV3peJL): I registered an email address and everything works. Kudos!
> Now, how do I register another email address?

Your mail adress = your ZeroID
Actually, ZeroMail was only slow yesterday (5h to receive a mail). Now it's very fast (5 minutes or less)

2_1MEWJRMLgvofqG9Mbsb2Rc4hFFyv7HeRx7.body:
> [nofish](#comment_411_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): It displays a "Do you want to give more space to this site?" dialog at 80% percent.

Nice feature. And if don't give more space, what happens ?

> [nofish](#comment_412_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Then you stop receiving new comments

The site stop updating, and that's all ?

> [nofish](#comment_413_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): Yes: no more space, no more message.

Nice. thanks for the answers

1_1LRrd96P7FiTcsyNXVzPM5jtpQoH1B4gYf.body: Also, I see that we can't clone ZeroBoard

2_17PhTjw3o2wPhxyKeM3Ss975eWZ1UMsjQC.body: Technically, if you visit a site with illegal content, you also share it... What about the law here ?

> [rasptyper](#comment_1_126KBTYhyC5CgVsVYDrzpm42mjin6ihjSj): I understood that you share the stuff you visited. Even worse, by the time you visited the site it might have looked legit, but you constantly download updates even if you don't visit the site again. So using VPN should be the best you can do. Not sure how TOR comes into play here

Using a VPN + TOR is the best solution ^^

> [rasptyper](#comment_3_126KBTYhyC5CgVsVYDrzpm42mjin6ihjSj): TOR for what ? Seriously, If you don't trust your VPN, change it !

My VPN is on my own server so I trust it a little bit :p
Also, ZeroNet uses TOR by default, and I don't see why it's a problem

> [rasptyper](#comment_4_126KBTYhyC5CgVsVYDrzpm42mjin6ihjSj): My one isn't so I'm sure it can't be traced back to me (that easily)

VPNs relies on the trust of your VPN provider :/

6_1MEWJRMLgvofqG9Mbsb2Rc4hFFyv7HeRx7.body: Found a solution : go to data\<site-id>\data\users and delete the folder of your user. Done ! :D

10_1MEWJRMLgvofqG9Mbsb2Rc4hFFyv7HeRx7.body:
It includes a lot of things that we can call deep web but if we stick at Wikipedia's definition, ZeroNet is part of it https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deep_web

ZeroNet is a P2P network, but we can use TOR to connect to other peers... Can it be considred as a "DarkNet" ? https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Darknet

> [pycole](#comment_96_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): As for the terminology: 'darknet' refers to content that is not indexed by search engines.

This is deep web, not darknet
